text: Hi, We are on ESXi 6.5 in the process of upgrading to 8.?. we have two hosts that are clustered with 2016 guests I have been reviewing this for some time and I am hoping someone in the group can clarify some things. I understand when you install the October CU (in our case KB5031362) that the guest OS may not start and in such a situation you can delete two files which will allow the guest OS to start up again. What I am trying to figure out are the following What OS’s are affect? I have been seeing 2022 and 2019. Is 2016 effected by this? Does this happen all the time? What if you are in a cluster. I have seen that this does not effect a cluster? What versions of ESXi if any does it affect if you are running on a ESXi Host. I have read 7 and under. Veeam told me that after removing the two files, next time you reboot the same problem will happen and you will have to delete the files again. I found in another place that is not true. There is so much out there that there does not appear to be any consistent answer. If somebody has some answers it would be a great help Thank You Adam Raff %40BL0PR18MB2099.namprd18.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] October patches
